metadata.name: Disable Recovery Booting
metadata.description:
{{{ full_name }}} systems support an "recovery boot" option that can be used to prevent services from being started. The GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY configuration option in /etc/default/grub should be set to true to disable the generation of recovery mode menu entries. It is also required to change the runtime configuration, run: 
$ sudo {{{ grub_command("update") }}}
metadata.rationale:
Using recovery boot, the console user could disable auditing, firewalls,
or other services, weakening system security.

manual_remediation:
